page.title: 01Introduction. Grid 04360390
page.content: The area is situated in the N.E of Sheffield on its boundary with Rotherham and crossed by the M1, at junction 34. The dominant geographical feature is Wincobank Hill, overlooking the former industrial valley of the Don. What was once the hub of Sheffield steel production is now an industrial wasteland with some newer, small, light industry. The private houses and council estates of Brightside, Shiregreen, Wincobank, Blackburn and Firth Park are served by the large Northern General Hospital, 3 large comprehensives and their feeder schools, 2 major shopping centres, 3 large parks and Concord Sports Centre.This area, with its roots deep in Sheffield's history, now has a growing Pakistani community living alongside its other residents.
